evidence.content: OECD health statistics show the United States spends approximately $11,945 per capita on healthcare annually, which is significantly higher than the next highest spending countries like Switzerland ($9,673) and Germany ($8,176).
The Commonwealth Fund's international comparison of healthcare systems confirms that per capita healthcare spending in the United States exceeds all other developed nations by a substantial margin.
The Amazon rainforest produces approximately 6-9% of the world's oxygen through photosynthesis. The myth that it produces 20% confuses oxygen production with carbon storage capability.

Ocean phytoplankton produce approximately 50% of Earth's oxygen, not the Amazon rainforest. The rainforest is crucial for climate regulation and biodiversity but not for oxygen production in the way commonly believed.
CDC data demonstrates that water fluoridation reduces dental caries by approximately 25% in children and 15% in adults. This has been confirmed by multiple randomized controlled trials.
WHO endorses water fluoridation as safe and effective for preventing tooth decay. Sixty years of research from over 100 countries confirms the benefits of fluoridation at recommended concentrations.
The INTERPHONE study, which examined mobile phone use and cancer risk across multiple countries, found no conclusive evidence that mobile phone use causes brain cancer.

The WHO classifies radiofrequency electromagnetic fields as 'possibly carcinogenic to humans' (Group 2B), but evidence remains weak and inconsistent. Long-term studies continue to show no direct causation.
evidence.source: WHO International Agency for Research on Cancer

evidence.content: NASA astronauts and space program officials have repeatedly confirmed that the Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye without magnification.
Satellite imagery and orbital photographs show that the Great Wall blends with the surrounding landscape due to its narrow width relative to orbital distance and Earth's curvature.
Research on goldfish memory shows they can remember for months and be trained to recognize shapes, colors, and sounds. Studies demonstrate memory capabilities lasting up to 5 months or longer.
Goldfish demonstrate memory persistence and learning capabilities that contradict the three-second memory myth. Trained goldfish can distinguish between different people and environments.

COVID-19 vaccines, including Pfizer, Moderna, and AstraZeneca, do not contain fetal cells. While fetal cell lines were used in research and development, the final vaccines contain only proteins and lipids.
Fetal cell lines are widely used in medical research and vaccine development across many products for non-political reasons. The vaccines do not contain living cells of any kind.
The Antarctic Ice Sheet covers approximately 98% of Antarctica. The remaining 2% consists of exposed rock outcrops and ice-free valleys such as the McMurdo Dry Valleys.
Antarctica is covered by the Antarctic Ice Sheet, one of the largest ice masses on Earth. Satellite measurements confirm continuous ice coverage across the vast majority of the continent.

The Titanic wreck is located at a depth of approximately 12,500 feet (3,800 meters) in the North Atlantic Ocean. This depth has been repeatedly verified through sonar mapping and submersible investigations.
Multiple submersible dives to the Titanic wreck have confirmed its location coordinates and depth. The wreck remains in stable condition at this depth in the North Atlantic.
The Empire State Building is struck by lightning approximately 20-25 times per year, demonstrating that lightning frequently strikes the same location multiple times.

Tall structures, mountain peaks, and specific geographical features are frequently struck by lightning multiple times. The myth that lightning never strikes the same place twice is definitively false.

Modern neuroscience using fMRI and PET imaging confirms that virtually all brain regions are active almost constantly, including during sleep. The brain uses approximately 20% of the body's energy at rest.
Neuroscientists have definitively disproven the 10% brain myth. All brain regions are active and essential; damage to any region results in measurable functional loss.
A 2013 study published in major medical journals estimated the human body contains approximately 37.2 trillion cells. This figure has been widely adopted as the standard reference.
The 37 trillion cell estimate accounts for approximately 30 trillion red blood cells and 7 trillion other cells. This breakdown is consistent across medical textbooks and biological references.
Multiple human-made structures are visible from the Moon if observers know where to look and use magnification, and the Great Wall is not among them.
Astronauts report the Great Wall is difficult to distinguish even from orbital altitude. The wall's narrow width makes it invisible to the naked eye from space.
Honey's low moisture content (typically 17-18%) and high acidity create an environment where bacteria cannot survive. Archaeologists have found 3,000-year-old honey that remains edible.
Honey has antimicrobial properties that inhibit bacterial growth. When properly stored in sealed containers, honey does not expire and can remain edible indefinitely.
Pure ethanol contains approximately 7 calories per gram regardless of source. However, alcoholic beverages vary in calorie content due to sugars, carbohydrates, and ingredients beyond just alcohol.
A typical beer contains 5-7% alcohol plus carbohydrates and sugars. Wine contains 12-15% alcohol with additional sugars. Spirits contain 40%+ alcohol with minimal additional calories.
Multiple controlled studies, including a meta-analysis published in major medical journals, found no direct link between sugar consumption and hyperactivity in children.
The sugar-hyperactivity myth persists due to expectancy bias and the context of sugar consumption at parties and celebrations with high stimulation environments.
The Dead Sea surface is located at approximately 1,410 feet (430 meters) below sea level, making it the lowest point on Earth's land surface.
The Mariana Trench is deeper than the Dead Sea at approximately 36,000 feet below sea level, but it is underwater. The Dead Sea remains the lowest point on land.
Glass is an amorphous solid, not a liquid. Its atomic structure and physical properties are consistent with solids, not liquids.
Thickness variations in old windows resulted from manufacturing processes used during glass production, not from glass flowing over centuries.
A longitudinal study following people who habitually cracked their knuckles found no increased risk of arthritis compared to control groups.
The popping sound from cracking knuckles results from gas bubbles collapsing in synovial fluid, not from joint damage. This process does not cause long-term harm.
Ophthalmologists confirm that reading in dim light does not cause permanent damage to eyesight. It may cause temporary eye strain and discomfort.
The eyes have self-healing capabilities for temporary strain. Long-term vision changes result from other factors like genetics and age, not from reading in dim light.
Dermatologists explain that hair appears thicker when shaved because the blunt edge of newly shaved hair feels coarser than the tapered natural tips.
Hair growth rate and thickness are determined by genetics and hormones, not by shaving. Shaving removes hair at the surface without affecting the follicle.
Microwaves emit non-ionizing radiation that heats food by exciting water molecules. Non-ionizing radiation cannot produce radioactivity.
Food heated in a microwave remains non-radioactive after cooking. The FDA confirms microwave safety and that microwave radiation does not make food radioactive.
The human eye is sensitive to visible light wavelengths between 380 and 700 nanometers. Ultraviolet light (10-380 nm) cannot be seen by humans.
The human eye is designed with protective mechanisms that filter out ultraviolet radiation. Some animals like honeybees can see ultraviolet light, but humans cannot.
The first transatlantic telegraph cable was successfully laid between Ireland and Newfoundland in 1858. It revolutionized international communication.
The 1858 transatlantic telegraph cable operated successfully for about 18 months before mechanical failure. It was the first successful direct communication link between Europe and North America.
Moderate alcohol consumption does not directly kill brain cells in healthy adults. However, excessive drinking and chronic alcohol abuse can damage brain tissue through various mechanisms.
Alcohol toxicity affects the brain primarily through malnutrition, oxidative stress, and inflammation rather than direct cell death. The extent of damage depends on consumption level and duration.
Analysis of maritime and aviation data shows the Bermuda Triangle region has no more disappearances than any other ocean area of similar size. The myth was popularized by a sensationalized 1974 book.
Insurance companies found no evidence of unusual risk in the Bermuda Triangle area. Disappearances in the region are consistent with other ocean regions of comparable size and traffic.
Earth is an oblate spheroid, slightly flattened at the poles due to rotation. Satellite imagery, gravity measurements, and physics all confirm this shape.
Circumnavigation, GPS technology, gravity measurements, and the observation of star positions changing with latitude all provide irrefutable evidence that Earth is spherical.
Genetic studies comparing human and chimpanzee DNA show approximately 98-99% sequence similarity. The remaining 1-2% difference accounts for significant physiological and behavioral divergence.
DNA sequence comparison between humans and chimpanzees is one of the strongest pieces of evidence for evolution. The high similarity reflects our common evolutionary ancestor.
